step1.sentence: She finally opened up about the anxiety she had been hiding for years.

step2.story: After months of keeping everything to himself, Marcus finally decided to open up about his struggles at work. His close friend listened quietly and without judgment, which made Marcus feel an enormous sense of relief. He realized he had been carrying that weight alone for far too long.

step3.story: Elena had always been known as the strong one in her friend group, never showing weakness or doubt. But one quiet evening, sitting across from her best friend over cups of tea, she finally decided to open up about the fear of failure that had been holding her back. She talked about how every time she was close to success, a voice in her head told her she didn't deserve it. Her friend reached across the table and held her hand, listening without interrupting. By the time the tea had gone cold, Elena felt lighter than she had in years, as though saying the words out loud had dissolved their power over her.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어떤 주제에 대해 속마음을 열고 솔직하게 이야기하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 감정, 개인적 고민, 비밀 등 평소 꺼내기 어려운 이야기를 상대방에게 솔직하게 털어놓을 때 사용한다. 신뢰하는 사람 앞에서 마음의 문을 여는 뉘앙스가 담겨 있다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'open up'은 '마음을 열다'라는 의미의 구동사이며, 여기에 대상을 나타내는 전치사 'about'이 결합되어 특정 주제에 대해 솔직히 말하는 행위를 가리키게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 정보 공유가 아니라, 감정적으로 어렵거나 사적인 이야기를 용기 있게 꺼내는 뉘앙스가 강하다. 취약성(vulnerability)을 드러내는 친밀하고 감성적인 맥락에서 주로 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: It took him years to open up about his childhood trauma.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 어린 시절의 트라우마에 대해 솔직하게 말하기까지 수년이 걸렸다.
